title: Tracking issue for `-Z randomize-layout`

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: A-cli
labels.description: Area: Command line interface to the compiler.

body:
This is a tracking issue for the unstable rustc flag `-Zrandomize-layout`. (https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/457)

### About tracking issues

Tracking issues are used to record the overall progress of implementation. They are also used as hubs connecting to other relevant issues, e.g., bugs or open design questions. A tracking issue is however *not* meant for large scale discussion, questions, or bug reports about a feature. Instead, open a dedicated issue for the specific matter and add the relevant feature gate label.

### Steps

- [x] Implementation
- [ ] Adjust documentation ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][doc-guide])
- [ ] Stabilization PR ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][stabilization-guide])

[stabilization-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#stabilization-pr
[doc-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#documentation-prs

### Unresolved Questions


### Implementation history

- **Feature request:** #77316
- **MCP:** https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/457
- #87868
- #91932
- #97861
